dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 1404 IH: Medicaid Expansion Repeal and State Flexibility Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Salmon (for himself, Mr. LaMalfa, Mr. Schweikert, Mr. Franks of Arizona, Mrs. Black, and Mr. Hunter) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend title XIX of the Social Security Act to eliminate the increased Federal medical assistance percentage under the State plan with respect to newly eligible mandatory individuals under Medicaid, to provide States with greater flexibility under Medicaid, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Medicaid Expansion Repeal and State Flexibility Act.

section.header: Eliminating increased FMAP under State plan with respect to newly eligible mandatory individuals and related equitable support for certain States

subsection.text: Section 1905 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396d) is amended by striking subsections (y) and (z).
Section 1905 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396d), as amended by subsection (a), is further amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (aa), by striking , subsections (y) and (z), each place it appears; and
in the first sentence of subsection (cc)—

subparagraph.text: by striking subsections (y), (z), and (aa) and inserting subsection (aa); and
by striking such subsections and inserting such subsection.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to payments to States for items and services furnished on or after the first day of the first State fiscal year that begins after the date of the enactment of this Act.

section.header: Providing greater flexibility to States by eliminating certain requirements imposed by Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

subsection.header: Repeal of maintenance of effort requirement
subsection.text: Section 1902 of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396a) is amended by striking subsection (gg).

subsection.header: Repeal of minimum essential coverage requirement for Medicaid benchmark benefits
subsection.text: Section 1937(b) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396u–7(b)) is amended by striking paragraph (5).

paragraph.text: Section 1902(a) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396a(a)) is amended by striking paragraph (74).

Paragraph (14)(A) (related to modified adjusted gross income) of section 1902(e) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396a(e)), as added by section 2002(a) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (Public Law 111–148), is amended by striking the third sentence.
Section 1937(b) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1396u–7(b)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking paragraphs (5) and (6) and inserting paragraph (6); and
in paragraph (2), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking paragraphs (5) and (6) and inserting paragraph (6).
